p: Vlietinck et al. (1995) evaluated the antibacterial properties of D. anomala root extract against various microorganisms including Microsporum canis, Candida albicans, Staphylococcus aureus, and Trichophyton mentagrophytes using agar well diffusion and dilution methods. Furthermore, they investigated the effects of D. anomala root extract on viruses such as coxsackie, herpes simplex, measles, semliki forest, and poliomyelitis through viral titer reduction [ 12].
